Readme¶

Introduction¶

rtp-prod creates blah blah

In order to run kcmix, the user also needs to install/download

  1. hdf packages
  2. rtp package, which is our native file format for storing atmospheric geophysical variables and instrument view geometry parameters, needed for RT calculations
  3. klayers package, which takes in a LEVELS rtp file and produces a LAYERS average rtp file, needed for RT calculations

Main Top Level Routines¶

This is all junk filler.

kcrad
Radiative transfer top-level wrapper, manages defaults and loops on chunks, calling kcmix2, contcalc, and rtchunk
rtchunk
Radiative transfer calc’s in 104point chunks, including reflected solar and basic reflected thermal
kcmix2
Calculates 25 1/cm chunks of mixed absorptions for a supplied profile, from tabulated compressed absorptions
kcmix100
Version of kcmix that assumes a 100-layer input profile with the same layers as the reference profiles
contcalc
Continuum calculation from kcarta tabulated values

Documentation¶

Documentation is available in the docs subdirectory, and is fairly up-to-date.
